intro: Echidnopsis golathi, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves and stems that help it store water, adapting to its harsh environment. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Echidnopsis golathi is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
